intro: Lagenophora montana var. major, commonly known as the mountain lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
